##### <a name="ssh_hosts"></a>`ssh_hosts`

Data type: `Hash[String, Hash]`



Default value: `{

      'order' => 99,
      'settings' => {
        'GSSAPIAuthentication' => true,
        'GSSAPIKeyExchange' => true,
        'GSSAPIDelegateCredentials' => true,
        'SendEnv' => 'LANG LC_CTYPE LC_NUMERIC LC_TIME LC_COLLATE LC_MONETARY LC_MESSAGES LC_PAPER LC_NAME LC_ADDRESS LC_TELEPHONE \
        LC_MEASUREMENT LC_IDENTIFICATION LC_ALL LANGUAGE XMODIFIERS',
      },
    },
  }`

### <a name="sshservermatch"></a>`ssh::server::match`

Introduces a conditional block. If all the criteria of the match are satisfied, the
settings override those set in the global section of the config file.

The arguments to match are one or more criteria-pattern pairs. The criteria are user,
group, host, and address. The patterns may consist of single entries or and array of entries.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
ssh::server::match { 'namevar':
  filter => {
    user => 'test',
  },
  settings => {
    banner => '/etc/issue.test'
  },
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `ssh::server::match` defined type:

* [`settings`](#settings)
* [`order`](#order)
* [`filter`](#filter)

##### <a name="settings"></a>`settings`

Data type: `Ssh::Settings`

Settings that should be applied to the match

##### <a name="order"></a>`order`

Data type: `Variant[Integer[0], String[1]]`

Priority of the match, lowest goes first

Default value: `10`

##### <a name="filter"></a>`filter`

Data type: `Optional[Ssh::Server::Match::Filter]`

Used to define a filter using a hash format. If not defined, the title is used as the match filter.

Default value: ``undef``

### <a name="sshserversubsystem"></a>`ssh::server::subsystem`

Configures an external subsystem (e.g. file transfer daemon). Arguments should
be a subsystem name and a command (with optional arguments) to execute upon
subsystem request.

The command sft-server implements the "sftp" file transfer subsystem.

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
ssh::server::subsystem { 'sftp':
  command => 'sftp-system',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `ssh::server::subsystem` defined type:

* [`subsystem`](#subsystem)
* [`command`](#command)
* [`arguments`](#arguments)

##### <a name="subsystem"></a>`subsystem`

Data type: `String`

A name to identify the subsystem

Default value: `$title`

##### <a name="command"></a>`command`

Data type: `Ssh::Server::Subsystem::Command`

Command for the external subsystem

##### <a name="arguments"></a>`arguments`

Data type: `Optional[Variant[Array[String[1], 1], String[1]]]`

Optional arguments for the subsystem

Default value: ``undef``

## Data types

### <a name="sshpattern"></a>`Ssh::Pattern`

Type to match a pattern for host and matches

Alias of

```puppet
Pattern[/\A!?((%[%CdhiLlnpru])|[^%[:space:]])+\Z/]
```

### <a name="sshpatterns"></a>`Ssh::Patterns`

Type to match a list of patterns

Alias of

```puppet
Variant[Array[Ssh::Pattern], Ssh::Pattern]
```

### <a name="sshservermatchfilter"></a>`Ssh::Server::Match::Filter`

Type to match a sshd config match

Alias of

```puppet
Struct[{
    Optional['user'] => Ssh::Patterns,
    Optional['group'] => Ssh::Patterns,
    Optional['host'] => Ssh::Patterns,
    Optional['localaddress'] => Ssh::Patterns,
    Optional['localport'] => Ssh::Patterns,
    Optional['address'] => Ssh::Patterns,
}]
```

### <a name="sshserversubsystemcommand"></a>`Ssh::Server::Subsystem::Command`

Type to match a subsystem command

Alias of

```puppet
Variant[Enum['sftp-server'], Stdlib::Absolutepath]
```

### <a name="sshsettings"></a>`Ssh::Settings`

Type to match a hash of settings

Alias of

```puppet
Hash[String[1], Variant[Array[ScalarData, 1], ScalarData]]
```
